definitions.title: Hiph.
definitions.body: snatch away, deliver (Ecclus Hiph. Pt. [[מחלת]] delivering Sir 40:24 b (Levi conj. [[יחיל]] Sir 40:24 a)); NH Hiph. = BH; BAram. Haph. id.; Syr. ns.al pour out; Ar. nas.ala intrans. tincturam exuit emisitque barba, ex cuspide excidit sagitta, etc., Kam Frey; Eth. III. tanas’la: evulsum vel abruptum excidere e suo loco, Di:698);—†
reflex. tear oneself away, deliver oneself: abs. Pr 6:3, Ez Eze 14:16, Eze 14:18, 2Ki 19:11 = Is 37:11; c. [[מִיַּד]] Pr 6:5; [[אֶל]] …[[מֵעִ ]] escape from-unto De 23:16.
passive,  be torn, out or away [[מִפִּי הָאֲרִי]] Am 3:12; be delivered, abs. Ge 32:31, Je 7:I0, Ps 33:16, Mic 4:30 [[מִפְּנֵי]] Is 20:6; [[מִכַּף]] Hb Hab 2:9; [[מִן]] Ps 69:15.
strip of, spoil, abs. 2Ch 20:25; c. acc. pers. Ex 3:22, Ex 12:36 (J).

take away, snatch away, e.g. property Ge 31:9, Ge 31:10 (E) Ho 2:11, prey from the mouth of animals 1Sa 17:35, Am 3:12, Ez Eze 34:10, words of ´[[י]] from the mouth Ps 119:43; [[וְאֵין מַצִּיל בֵּינֵיהֶם]] 2Sa 14:6 and there was none to tear them apart (two fighting); [[עֵינֵנוּ וְהִצִּיל]] 2Sa 20:6 and take away our eye (elude our sight, Ges; Ew We after LXX cast shadow over our eye, denom. from [[חֵל]] Bö Th after SyrVer tear away our eye, harm us irretrievably, v. Dr:18 26. 2.; HPS escape from us [[[מִמֶּנּוּ]], as LXXL], cf. Bu [[[וְנִצַּל]]]). †
rescue, recover, e.g. cities Ju Jdg 11:26; wives and property 1Sa 30:8, 1Sa 30:18, 1Sa 30:22.

deliver from sin and guilt (in late writings), [[מִכָּל־פְּשָׁעַי]] Ps 39:9 from all my trangression; [[מִדָּמִים]] Ps 51:6 from bloodguiltiness; [[הַצִּילֵנוּ וְכַפֵּר עַל־חַטּאׂתֵינוּ]] Ps 79:9 deliver us and cover over all our sins; prob. also [[כְּאִמְרָֽתְ ְהַצִּילֵנִי]] Ps 119:170.

definitions.title: Hoph.
definitions.body: Pt. [[מֻצּל]];—[[בְּאוּד מֻצָּל מִשְּׂרֵטָה]] Am 4:11 as a brand plucked out of the burning; [[מֵאֵשׁ]] Zec 3:2 from the fire.

definitions.title: Hithp.
definitions.body: [[וַיִּתְנַצְּלוּ אֶת־עֶדְיׇם]] Ex 33:6 (E) and they stripped themselves of their ornaments.
